top_categories.workout_context: At 100 miles, Ghost of the Gravel punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Ghost of the Gravel rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Ghost of the Gravel’s alberta prairie, canadian gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Ghost of the Gravel isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Ghost of the Gravel. Make this intensity feel like home.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Ghost of the Gravel when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Ghost of the Gravel’s alberta prairie gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
At 100 miles, Ghost of the Gravel rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Every session at Ghost of the Gravel intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Ghost of the Gravel’s alberta prairie gravel delivers on race day.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Ghost of the Gravel — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Ghost of the Gravel — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Ghost of the Gravel’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Ghost of the Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on alberta prairie gravel to build confidence. Expect: alberta prairie, canadian gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, TT Threshold, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 100 miles of alberta prairie gravel in Alberta, Canada.
